attributes.action: Allow The House of Lords to appoint a body, of its choosing, to conduct an Inquiry into how the British Government came to the decision on sending troops into Iraq without any serious planning of what would follow the immediate overthrow of Saddam Hussein?
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I am starting this petition because I feel deeply let down by the way Prime Minister Blair has been led by US foreign policy over Iraq.

"The Prime Minister urges us to look forward and not back, but you can make better decisions in the future only if you know how you made your mistakes in the past. Somewhere in our system, fences were broken and walls were breached, and we need to repair them before the system is put to the test again." 

"I believe that we are living through one of the worst setbacks for British foreign policy for many years. We are still living with that story, and we cannot be sure how it will end."

please refer to The Rt Hon Lord Hurd's speech - Hansard 22 Feb 2007.

Some of which I have quoted above as my petition was kick started by the Iraq debate in the House of Lords on the 22 Fed 07 - televised 3 Apr 07
